titles.title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to transfer to the Administrator of General Services the Old U.S. Mint in San Francisco, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6861)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus without amendment. With written report No. 103-302.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 508.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/2/1994--Passed Senate amended. Instructs the Secretary of the Treasury to transfer to the Administrator of General Services the Old U.S. Mint in San Francisco, California. Declares that this Act does not require the General Services Administration to repair the Old U.S. Mint building prior to repairing other Federal buildings in greater need of repair.
